name: slipped seed stitch hand towel
notes:
materials 

purl soho’s [oleander][1], 50% cotton and 50% linen. each skein is 205 yards/ 50 grams.
- color a: 1 (2) ball(s); approximately 185 (340) total yards required
- color b: 1 (2) ball(s); approximately 155 (280) total yards required

you'll also need...
- us 4 (3.5 mm), straight, or 16- or 24-inch [circular needles][2]
- if using straight needles: two us 4 [double pointed needles][3] for i-cord

we knit our samples in the following sizes and colors…
- small towel- color a: putty gray; color b: gray spruce
- small towel- color a: coral pink; color b: blue sage
- large towel- color a: burnt sienna; color b: pignoli nut

gauge
40 stitches and 78 rows = 4 inches in stitch pattern

size 
small towel (large towel)

finished dimensions: 10 inches wide x 17 inches long (15 inches wide x 21 inches long)

designed by purl soho designer, [keith foster][4]. see even more of keith’s work [on his website][5]!


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/oleander.html
  [2]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions.html?collection_filter=23796_23802
  [3]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/knitting-and-crochet.html?collection_filter=23799
  [4]: https://www.purlsoho.com/create/tag/keith-foster-for-purl-soho/
  [5]: https://www.kelsongoods.com/
